summary: This is an FBI Task Force Officer's affidavit in support of a search warrant application to search 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The affidavit details the seizure of devices from Epstein upon his arrest, from his New York mansion, and from his private island, Little Saint James. It establishes probable cause to search for evidence of sex trafficking, enticement, and transportation of minors, and implicates Ghislaine Maxwell and other associates as co-conspirators. The document includes extensive descriptions of evidence found, including thousands of nude photographs of young girls, and references victim and witness interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation, indicted for sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. His electronic devices were seized upon arrest and from his residences. He died in custody in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a potential co-conspirator who helped facilitate and participate in Epstein's abuse of minors, including transportation and enticement of victims. Her communications and photographs were found on seized devices.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the indictment arrest warrant for Epstein and multiple search warrants for the New York residence and seized discs.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: Signed the search warrant application on June 26, 2020.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Signed the Fourth Search Warrant for the New York Residence on July 11, 2019.

persons.name: Kevin Nathaniel Fox
persons.context: Signed the Fifth Search Warrant for devices seized from Epstein and the suitcase on July 14, 2019.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Signed the Sixth Search Warrant for the Virgin Islands Residence on August 11, 2019.

persons.name: James L. Cott
persons.context: Signed the Seventh Search Warrant for devices seized from Little Saint James on September 12, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney on the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator who helped facilitate Epstein's abuse of minors, including transportation, enticement, and participation in sexualized massages.

Employee-2 is identified in the indictment as an employee who facilitated Epstein's abuse by scheduling victims' encounters and was a target of the ongoing investigation. Epstein wired $250,000 to this person in December 2018.
Email communication shows Individual-4 asking Maxwell for details on payments for identifying 'beautiful, talented young women' to 'train/work with' Epstein, suggesting recruitment for sex acts.

Email communications show Individual-5 asking Maxwell to find 'new inappropriate friends' and arrange for 'girls' on trips, with Maxwell responding about arranging '2 legged sight seeing' (intelligent pretty fun girls from good families).

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI at Teterboro Airport upon arrival from France. Two electronic devices (iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Searches of New York Residence
events.description: Multiple searches were executed at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices, compact discs, binders of photographs, and other evidence including a massage room with sex toys and nude photographs.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and pronounced dead.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James
events.description: A search warrant was executed at Epstein's private island in the U.S. Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell began abusing Minor Victim-1 when she was approximately 14 years old, including sexual abuse in New York and Florida and involvement in group sexualized massages.

events.title: $250,000 Payment to Employee-2
events.description: Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to Employee-2 days after the Miami Herald published articles about his sexual misconduct, suggesting an attempt to influence a potential witness.

events.title: Epstein Amends Will
events.description: Epstein amended his will to change bequests, including leaving $10 million to Ghislaine Maxwell and forgiving loans to Employee-2.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York Residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Florida residence mentioned in indictment)
Zorro Ranch, New Mexico (Epstein's property referenced on disc labels)
keyFacts: The affidavit seeks to search 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties for evidence of sex trafficking, enticement, and transportation of minors, expanding the scope of earlier warrants.

Evidence recovered from Epstein's New York home included thousands of nude or partially nude photographs of girls and young women, many appearing to be under 18, stored on compact discs with labels like 'Young [Name]', 'Nudes 00-24', 'Girl Pics Nude', and references to 'Zorro' and 'LSJ' (Little Saint James).

Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a co-conspirator who facilitated abuse, including transporting and enticing at least one minor victim, and her communications about recruiting young women were found on seized devices.

The affidavit details a post-search incident where an employee removed contents from a safe at the New York residence after the initial search and delivered them to a third party, who later surrendered the items, including hard drives, to the FBI.

The investigation revealed Epstein's abuse of minors started earlier than previously indicted (as early as 1994) and involved multiple properties, with evidence suggesting the Virgin Islands residence was a location for photo shoots and abuse of underage girls.
